arts.ttl: Chris Davies explains ruthless hooking of Birmingham City winger Keshi Anderson
arts.sum: Chris Davies says a suspected dead leg played its part in his decision to hook Keshi Anderson in the 34th minute of Birmingham City’s defeat to Shrewsbury Town. Blues suffered their second League One loss to Shrewsbury, who started the day at the foot of the table, after Aaron Pierre, John Marquis and Tom Bloxham’s goals.

arts.ttl: Gareth Ainsworth hails sensational Shrewsbury Town
arts.sum: It was a wet and windy day as Storm Bert continued to cause havoc as it hit the UK's shores, but Town fans left smiling as they got their third win of the season against arguably the best side in the division. A couple of the Birmingham players, who I know, when they came off said your boys deserved that because they gave us one hell of a game.

arts.ttl: Chris Davies issues apology after Birmingham City 'a million miles away' at Shrewsbury
arts.sum: Chris Davies has apologised to Birmingham City’s fans following his team’s 3-2 defeat to Shrewsbury Town. The Blues faithful showed their discontent at full-time at The Croud Meadow and Davies began his post-match press conference with an apology.

arts.ttl: League One’s most in-form player tipped for Birmingham City rejects 'club record offer'
arts.sum: Kwame Poku’s electric form for Peterborough United is likely to spark a scramble for his signature next summer – and Posh transfer chief Barry Fry has tipped Birmingham City to make a move for the winger. Speaking on the Keep Right On Podcast before Blues played Posh in September, Fry suggested Gardner is keen on one of his players and he later identified Poku.

arts.ttl: Gareth Ainsworth off to winning start as Shrewsbury edge out Birmingham
arts.sum: Ainsworth secured victory in his first game in charge.

arts.ttl: Gareth Ainsworth outlines his key Shrewsbury Town focus
arts.sum: Salop are rock bottom of the League One table having taken eight points from their first 15 games of the season. "I defend from the front, I'll defend with all the players on the pitch, and so it's not just one person, it's not four people, it's the whole team, we need to be more solid as an outfit, and that's something that I'm working on, although again it's been tough to get on the grass this week so we're doing it on screens.

arts.ttl: Chris Davies will change his plan to cope with Birmingham City’s brutal schedule
arts.sum: To be involved in four competitions this season, with a 46-game league schedule as well, it’s demanding but I love it. “I’ve got an idea in my head of possible rotations but the context always shifts after each game played, and form, and results,” says Davies.

arts.ttl: Birmingham City's League One rivals announce huge takeover update and give timeline
arts.sum: Birmingham City's League One rivals Bristol Rovers have confirmed that chairman Hussain Al Saeed is set to take full control of the club by acquiring the remaining 45 per cent shares from Wael and Samer Al Qadi over the next 18 months. The club released a statement, saying: "Bristol Rovers Football Club would like to announce that an agreement has been reached for Hussain Al Saeed to acquire all shares (45 per cent) held by Wael and Samer Al Qadi.

arts.ttl: Shrewsbury Town enter period of exclusivity with potential buyers
arts.sum: He said: "I am delighted to say following the chairman’s statement earlier this month, we are now officially in an exclusivity period with our new potential owners. Salop chairman Roland Wycherley revealed in a statement when Paul Hurst was sacked, that the club was in advanced negotiations with a party interested in buying Town.

arts.ttl: Birmingham City manager Chris Davies has made his position on January exits crystal clear
arts.sum: Such is the strength of Blues’ squad this season, a number of players used to featuring regularly at a higher level have barely played in League One. The club’s former captain, Dion Sanderson, has only started once in the league and has just five appearances to his name across all competitions. What Davies doesn’t want is for Blues to end the January window with a smaller squad than they start it.
